procedure.description: postp matchers attempts to create properties and set values with colon or equal sign separated name/value pairs. For example, the step output lable text : value lable2 text = value2 Results in the new properties 'label text'='value' and 'label2 text' set to 'value2'

formalParameter.description: Specifies where to create the new properties. Leave blank to save all the properties to the job step or supply a path. Include the trailing slash in the path.

step.command: print <<EOF; first field : firstfieldValue second field = second field value third filed: third 3 value EOF

procedure.description: Create a file or generate a job step log output based on a template and substitution parameters. Backslashes need to be escaped.

formalParameter.description: Directory location for the new file.
Destination for the document. 0 - Step Log 1 - File
A template document with property subsutition to be filled in at run time.

formalParameter.defaultValue: Here's my template value1 : $[value1] Here's a windows path: $[winPath]

property.value: Here's my template value1 : $[value1] Here's a windows path: $[winPath]
Here's my template value1 : $[value1] Here's a windows path: $[winPath]
Here's my template value1 : $[value1] Here's a windows path: $[winPath]
Here's my template value1 : $[value1] Here's a windows path: $[winPath]

procedure.description: Illustrates how to use Javascript to validate an input parameter.
